alert.note: Alert for Southeast Yuma County; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 06 at 1:26PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Yuma County through 215 PM MST... At 126 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles south of Ligurta, or 19 miles southeast of Fortuna Foothills, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, nickel size hail, and areas of blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Yuma County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
